thread.title: Waikato police arrest man after high-speed chase
thread.title_full: Waikato police arrest man after high-speed chase

title: Waikato police arrest man after high-speed chase
text:
Waikato police arrest man after high-speed chase Last updated 13:26, February 11 2017 SIMON MAUDE / FAIRFAX NZ 
Police abandoned the chase twice when speeds became excessive. The fleeing driver crashed near Te Kowhai. 
A 22-year-old man led police on a high-speed chase in Waikato on Saturday morning, before crashing the stolen car and being arrested. 
Huntly police spotted the stolen car being driven dangerously at 10.40am on State Highway 1 north of Huntly. The driver refused to stop and a brief chase ensued, heading south. 
However, the unit pulled back when excessive speeds were reached. 
The stolen car was next spotted in Lake Road, off the Gordonton Road between Taupiri and Gordonton, heading toward River Road.
